body.name: The Alpha's Catch: A Paranormal Werewolf Romance novella (Shifters of Grey Ridge)
body.description: Sean's ready to turn his life upside down when the girl of his dreams lands in his arms, literally. After rescuing Sam from a devastating blaze, this stubborn shifter falls fast and hard. But when Sam bolts in the middle of the night, he's left alone in Grey Ridge, wishing he never let his guard down.Sam has never relied on anyone. She's forced to lean upon a brawny stranger after a fire that nearly took her life, and while she enjoyed every minute, it can't turn into something real. Or can it?When Sam is forced to return to Grey Ridge and accept Sean's help once more, she has a chance to repair the damage she's done. But will he ever trust her again?And more importantly, should he?This is a standalone novella linked to the Shifters of Grey Ridge series. It features handsome heroes, shifters of all kinds and lots of heat.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Emotional with the perfect hea
reviews.reviewText: I thoroughly enjoyed this book. The trauma reactions felt real. The emotions were well done. Its been a while since I've read a shifter story this good.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I got this free on stuff your kindle day. I liked it just not enough to pay 4 to 5.00 A book for the series. Guess I will look back off and on to see if there's a sale.Sam suffers from anxiety from a fire and she hasn't been sleeping or eating. Her friend calls Sean which happens to be a Lion Shifter. I was happy in the end that she came back.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I like this short romance, but I need the conversation of Hayley Cooper Sam Sean etc… After they became one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars It was good
reviews.reviewText: Obviously it's a Shifters book with mates, which is my favorite 😍 this book had all the right emotions. The 3 stars is mainly for some of the mistakes found in the novella. I also found myself wanting the ending to be more than what was given. Like what happened to Sam and Sean next. But no such luck. I did enjoy the book though very quick read. Finished in about an hour.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cementing my new found enjoyment of paranormal books
reviews.reviewText: I just recently opened my reading genre to include paranormal tropes and found this book. Needless to say I will be binge reading the rest of her work!! I love the novella-length books and Reece did an awesome job of weaving the storyline in a shorter read while keeping the spice level right where I like it. I loved the use of the “memories” both Sean and Sam had of their time first together to help the story along. Great read and thank you for pulling me into another genre!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars The title is misleading but good book.
reviews.reviewText: Its a pretty nice and short book. Couple of confusing lines\words. But the title is misleading. The male character isn't an alpha or werewolf.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed reading this book it was very entertaining and I look forward to reading the other books in the series.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Ending could’ve been better and not such a cliffhanger but held my attention pretty well. Wasn’t a bad read .
I enjoyed this book, I just wish it went into more detail. Definitely going to read the other Shifters of Grey Ridge books.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 4, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This is a standalone novella in the Shifters of Grey Ridge series, although if you follow the timeline of the series this should be read after book 1. I read this before book 1 but it didn't spoil the story for me.Sean runs the bar and has an amazing connection and one amazing night with Sam, his fated mate, but then she vanishes on him. She's human and doesn't know the way Sean feels for her.After trying to contact her and failing, he resigns himself to not seeing her again, but then she re-appears and he hopes for a second chance, but that would be far too easy.I really liked Sean's character, he wanted to be with his mate, but wasn't going to chase her too much and frighten her away. Sam seemed to have some big issues she needed to deal with, and was extremely lucky that Sean was willing to give her another chance as her go-to for dealing with things is to run away.- fated mates- PNR- bear shifter- he falls first- steamy- standalone with HEA

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 16, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Binge worthy story with wtf moments and an ending I was so relieved to read! Tine for the next book in the series

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Loved the story line. It is the first time I am reading one of novels by Reese Bardon. Really enjoyed the way she brings the characters together and still slips in their personal stories. It would be nice to have an epilogue. Highly recommended. I'm going to see what other books I can find of this author and stock up.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Keeping u on the edge of your seat and enjoying a good read then this is the book for you 100% enjoyed reading
